list.abs: the outcast boy was brought up by the government ., 这个被遗弃的孩子是由政府抚养大的.

she imagined herself a belated traveler , a poor girl , an outcast , quenching her thirst at the wayside brook , her little packet of cresses doing duty for a bundle of clothes .她想象自己是一个日暮无归处的旅人，一个穷姑娘，一个流浪汉在路旁小溪内喝水解渴，那一小包水田芹就权充衣包。

where wearing the wrong sneakers can make us life outcasts ., 穿错鞋子都可能让我们受人鄙视.

means.word_mean: 1. a person belonging to no caste
1. not belonging to or having been expelled from a caste and thus having no place or status in society;

auth_sentence.content: Several hundred village families are outcaste Mushahar, who live among goats, pigs and swarms of flies in a dried-out gully.
